page.title: 15All Saints Church Bubwith
page.content: {Bubwith All Saints Church}is situated on the bank of the river Derwent.The church is about 1000 years old and it is made of{Tadcaster stone.}In the eighteenth century the roof was ripped off in a fierce gale and was replaced by the present oak beam roof.In the stonework on the inside there are bits of figures like,for instance,an angel on top of the alter arch,and a face on the north wall near the alter.Under the carpet near the alter there are two strange graves. They have crooked crosses,skulls and cross bones on them. These symbols are crooked because the people who engraved them without permission had to do it at the dead of night.
